page.title: 11ST.CHRISTOPHER'S CHURCH
page.content: St.Christopher's is the Parish Church of Winfrith Newburgh.Nowadays the vicar,Mr.Moorsom,looks after four parishes.Lulworth,East Lulworth, Chaldon Herring and Winfrith Newburgh. The Norman Porches of the church are the oldest parts.The church was enlarged in 1852.In the 1930's the chancel roof was rebuilt using one large oak tree.Hidden in the roof is a bottle containing all the names of all the workmen.The lych Gate was added after the 1st. World War by local craftsmen using local timber. Mr.Moorsom comes to school to talk to us every week.Our school goes to sprcial services at the church for Harvest Festival,Christmas and Easter. We have a Leaver's Service in the Summer,and all the children who are leaving the school are allowed to climb up the tower.
